models.name: AdvertiserCurrencyBalance
models.description: The outstanding balance of all unpaid Advertiser Invoices, indexed by each distinct currency of the unpaid invoices.  The fields of this model are determined at runtime based on the number of distinct currencies found on unpaid invoices for this Advertiser.  Each field is named for the currency it represents, e.g. "USD" or "EUR" and the value of each currency field is an object with properties "currency" (the currency; same as field name), "amount" (the outstanding amount in the specified currency), and "converted_amount" (the corresponding amount converted to the Network currency, which is identified by the Preference named "network_currency").

models.name: AffiliateCurrencyBalance
models.description: The outstanding balance of all unpaid Affiliate Invoices, indexed by each distinct currency of the unpaid invoices.  The fields of this model are determined at runtime based on the number of distinct currencies found on unpaid invoices for this Affiliate.  Each field is named for the currency it represents, e.g. "USD" or "EUR" and the value of each currency field is an object with properties "currency" (the currency; same as field name), "amount" (the outstanding amount in the specified currency), and "converted_amount" (the corresponding amount converted to the Network currency, which is identified by the Preference named "network_currency").

fields.description: Whether or not to use the custom weights feature to determine how often each creative for this campaign is served. For more information, see: http://support.hasoffers.com/entries/23312738-Custom-weights-the-ad-manager-campaign

fields.description: Only required for campaigns with the "type" field set to "banner".  Specifies height used to display the ad tag.  Cannot change once creatives have been assigned to this campaign.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type creatives used in this campaign. Campaigns of type "text" can only contain text creatives, but can be displayed using a javascript ad tag with no specific height and width.  Campaigns of type "banner" are limited to a specific height and width, but can contain images, flash banners, and third party ad tags. models.name: AdCampaignCreative
models.description: An Advertising Campaign Creative.

fields.name: ad_campaign_id
fields.description: The ID of the Ad Campaign to which the creative belongs.

fields.name: custom_weight
fields.description: The percent (relative to other creatives in the campaign) that this one should be served.  Applicable only if the Ad Campaign has "custom_weights" enabled.  If the sum total of the custom weights on creatives for an Ad Campaign are over 100%, the creatives without a custom weight will not be displayed.  If the sum total is below 100%, the creatives with a custom weight will only display the given percentage; any unallocated percentage will use the given optimization setting for the campaign.  If a creative cannot be found for the given optimization, a random creative will be displayed (Geo Targeting applied).

Applicable only if the "affiliate_fraud_profile" Preference is enabled. For more information, see: http://www.hasoffers.com/wiki/Application_Support:Affiliate_Profile_Fraud.

models.name: AffiliateFraudAlert
models.description: Affiliate Fraud Alerts are generated when affiliates perform actions that may be fraudulent. These can be generated when either the "affiliate_fraud_activity" or "affiliate_fraud_profile" Preferences is enabled. For more information, see: http://support.hasoffers.com/hc/en-us/articles/202674578-Affiliate-Activity-Fraud.

fields.name: affiliate_id
fields.description: The ID of the Affiliate for which this Fraud Alert was generated.

fields.name: data
fields.description: DEPRECATED.  Ignore the content of this field.

fields.name: date_updated
fields.description: The time the Fraud Alert was generated.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique, auto-generated ID for this Affiliate Fraud Alert.

fields.name: is_active
fields.description: Whether or not the fraud alert is recent (within the past month).

fields.name: is_enabled
fields.description: Whether or not this fraud alerting type is enabled for this Affiliate.

fields.name: notes
fields.description: More detailed information about how the fraud alert was generated.

fields.name: preference_name
fields.description: The type of fraudulent activity that caused the alert to be generated.  "affiliate_fraud_profile_criteria_po_box" indicates a PO Box address.  "affiliate_fraud_profile_criteria_no_address_number" indicates no number found in the account address.  "affiliate_fraud_profile_criteria_address_length" indicates and account address less than 6 characters long.  "affiliate_fraud_profile_criteria_region_zip_match" indicates (for U.S. accounts only) that an invalid zip code was provided for the specified state.  "affiliate_fraud_profile_criteria_email_domain" indicates that the provided domain name for the email address does not have an MX record.  "affiliate_fraud_profile_criteria_free_email" indicates that the email address is a known free email provider.  "affiliate_fraud_profile_criteria_phone_country_match" indicates that the provided phone number does not match the country.  "affiliate_fraud_profile_criteria_phone_800" indicates that a toll free area code was provided.  "affiliate_fraud_profile_criteria_ip_country_match" indicates that the IP address used to sign up does not match the country of the account.  "affiliate_fraud_profile_criteria_individuals_check" indicates that an individual (checking account) was provided for billing.  "affiliate_fraud_profile_criteria_duplicate_signup" indicates a possible duplicate account (several fields are similar to an existing account).  "affiliate_fraud_profile_criteria_account_changes" indicates that account information has changed.

fields.name: value
fields.description: DEPRECATED.  Ignore the content of this field.

models.description: This contains information about the Affiliate account as well as the payment details that have been specified.  The payment details listed on this model are shared with each of the PaymentMethod models so they are not documented here.  Updates to payment details should be performed on the PaymentMethod models directly.

fields.name: affiliate_id
fields.description: The ID of the Affiliate whose payment details are specified.

fields.name: ssn_tax
fields.description: The VAT / Tax ID for the Affiliate.  This field is present only if the Network has VAT taxing enabled (dictated by the Preference named "enable_affiliate_vat").

models.name: AffiliateOffer
models.description: Used to define several aspects of an Affiliate's relationship with an Offer.  Holds the application of an Affiliate to run a private Offer, an Offer which requires approval, or an Offer which requires terms and conditions agreement.  Also used to specify an Affiliate-specific hostname to use for an offer.

fields.name: affiliate_id
fields.description: The Affiliate ID.

fields.name: agreed_terms_and_conditions
fields.description: The date on which the Affiliate agreed to the terms and conditions, or NULL if the Affiliate has not.

fields.name: approval_notes
fields.description: A note to send to the Affiliate in response to their application.

fields.name: approval_status
fields.description: The status of the offer application.  If the offer only requires terms and conditions acceptance but is not private nor does it require approval, this will be NULL.

fields.name: hostname_id
fields.description: A Hostname ID.  If present, specifies an alternative/custom hostname for this Affiliate's tracking links for the Offer.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique, auto-generated ID for this AffiliateOffer.

fields.name: offer_id
fields.description: The Offer ID.

models.name: AffiliateReceipt
models.description: A receipt of payment made to an Affiliate.

fields.name: affiliate_id
fields.description: The ID of the Affiliate to whom this receipt records payment.

fields.name: amount
fields.description: The amount paid.

fields.name: currency
fields.description: The 3-character currency code identifying the currency used for this payment.

fields.name: date
fields.description: The date of the payment.

fields.name: datetime
fields.description: The date this receipt was created (not necessarily the date of payment).

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique ID for this Receipt.

fields.name: memo
fields.description: A memo visible to the Affiliate.

fields.name: method
fields.description: The method used to make the payment.

fields.name: notes
fields.description: Internal notes.

fields.name: payment_details
fields.description: A serialized form of the Affiliate's payment method details that were used to make this payment.  This allows the payment details to be visible in the future even if the Affiliate changes their billing preferences.

fields.name: payment_info
fields.description: Same as the "payment_details" field but in unserialized (object) form.

fields.name: payment_id_ref
fields.description: DEPRECATED.  This field should be ignored.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The status of this payment.

fields.name: token
fields.description: A payment reference field without any predefined meaning.  Empty string if no value is present.

fields.name: transaction_id
fields.description: A payment reference field without any predefined meaning.  Empty string if no value is present.

fields.name: user_id
fields.description: DEPRECATED.  This field should be ignored.

models.name: AffiliateReferralCommission
models.description: Describes a custom Affiliate Referral commission setting for an Affiliate. For more information, see: http://support.hasoffers.com/hc/en-us/articles/202305546-Affiliate-Referrals#setting-custom-commissions.

fields.name: affiliate_id
fields.description: The ID of the Affiliate whose referral commission rate this describes.

fields.name: field
fields.description: Field used from stats to base commission calculations.  Only applicable if "rate_type" is set to "percentage".

fields.name: rate
fields.description: The rate being paid.  When "rate_type" is "percentage" this is the percentage as a whole number, e.g. 5.25% would be stored as 5.25.  When "rate_type" is flat, this is the amount in currency that is paid per referral, e.g. $3.25 would be stored as 3.25.

fields.name: rate_type
fields.description: Method to compute commission using the "field" value.  If "flat", then a flat rate is paid for each referred account.  If "percentage" then referrals are paid based on the "rate" property, using the metric identified by the "field" property.  Example 1 -- ("rate_type" is "flat" and "rate" is 5.00: 10 referral accounts x $5 per referral = $50 commission).  Example 2 -- ("rate_type" is "percentage", commission "field" is "payout", "rate" is 5.00: $100 in payout x 5% = $5 commission)

models.name: AffiliateTier
models.description: Affiliate Tiers are used to group Affiliates together who should receive similar payouts for Offers and Goals. For more information, see http://support.hasoffers.com/hc/en-us/articles/202266783-Offer-Payouts#payout-tiers.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique, auto-generated ID for the Affiliate Tier.

fields.name: is_default
fields.description: Whether or not this Tier is the default.  There should only be one default Tier in the Network.  If an Affiliate has not been assigned to any Tier, they will be treated as part of the default Tier.

fields.name: level
fields.description: A relative number used for visual sorting purposes in the application.  Tiers are usually displayed by level descending.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name given to the Affiliate Tier.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The status of the Affiliate Tier.

models.name: AffiliateTierPayout
models.description: Defines a payout specific to an Offer or Goal, for an Affiliate Tier.

fields.name: affiliate_tier_id
fields.description: The ID of the AffiliateTier that this Payout is for.  Affiliates in the referenced Tier will receive this payout.

fields.name: goal_id
fields.description: The Goal this payout is for, if it should apply to a Goal instead of the Offer.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique, auto-generated ID for this Affiliate Tier Payout.

fields.name: modified
fields.description: The last time this Affiliate Tier Payout was modified.

fields.name: offer_id
fields.description: The Offer this payout amount is defined for.
fields.runtimeDefault: If a "goal_id" is provided, the "offer_id" is not required as it will be looked up and stored automatically.

fields.name: payout
fields.description: The flat rate/amount paid out.  This is applicable depending on the "payout_type" of the Offer (or Goal).

fields.name: percent_payout
fields.description: The percent paid out.  This is applicable depending on the "payout_type" of the Offer (or Goal).

models.name: AffiliateTierRevenue
models.description: Defines a revenue specific to an Offer or Goal, for an Affiliate Tier.

fields.name: affiliate_tier_id
fields.description: The ID of the AffiliateTier that this Revenue is for.  Affiliates in the referenced Tier are set to have this amount of revenue.

fields.name: goal_id
fields.description: The Goal this revenue is for, if it should apply to a Goal instead of the Offer.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique, auto-generated ID for this Affiliate Tier Revenue.

fields.name: modified
fields.description: The last time this Affiliate Tier Revenue was modified.

fields.name: offer_id
fields.description: The Offer this revenue amount is defined for.
fields.runtimeDefault: If a "goal_id" is provided, the "offer_id" is not required as it will be looked up and stored automatically.

fields.name: revenue
fields.description: The flat rate/amount revenue.  This is applicable depending on the "revenue_type" of the Offer (or Goal).

fields.name: percent_revenue
fields.description: The percent revenue.  This is applicable depending on the "revenue_type" of the Offer (or Goal).

models.name: AffiliateUser
models.description: A user belonging to an Affiliate account.

fields.name: access
fields.description: An array of permissions that the Affiliate User has.  This array contains a value "Affiliate" that grants base Affiliate permissions.  Other possible permissions are: "Affiliate.account_management" (Ability to manage account users), "Affiliate.API" (Permission to request and use Affiliate API V3), "Affiliate.offer_management" (Ability to manage offers), "Affiliate.stats" (Ability to view stats, graphs and reports), "Affiliate.user_management" (Ability to manage account users).

fields.name: affiliate_id
fields.description: The ID of the Affiliate this User belongs to.

fields.name: cell_phone
fields.description: The Affiliate User's cell phone.

fields.name: email
fields.description: The Affiliate User's email address.

fields.name: first_name
fields.description: The Affiliate User's first name.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique, auto-generated ID for the Affiliate User.

fields.name: join_date
fields.description: The date the Affiliate User was created.

fields.name: last_login
fields.description: The last time the Affiliate User logged into the application.

fields.name: last_name
fields.description: The Affiliate User's last name.

fields.name: modified
fields.description: The last time the Affiliate User account was updated.

fields.name: password
fields.description: The Affiliate User's password.

fields.name: password_confirmation
fields.description: Provided on creation and must match the provided "password" field.

fields.name: permissions
fields.description: The Affiliate User's permissions stored as a bitmask.  See the "access" field for readable permission names.  This should not be set or updated directly; instead, the AffiliateUser::grantAccess and AffiliateUser::removeAccess API functions should be used to grant to, and revoke permissions from, Affiliate Users.

fields.name: phone
fields.description: The Affiliate User's phone number.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The Affiliate User status.

fields.name: title
fields.description: The Affiliate User's title.

fields.name: wants_alerts
fields.description: DEPRECATED.  This field should be ignored.

models.name: AffiliateUserAlert
models.description: This model associates an Alert with an Affiliate User, making it visible to that user.

fields.name: affiliate_user_id
fields.description: The ID of the Affiliate User the Alert is for.

fields.name: alert_id
fields.description: The ID of the Alert for the Affiliate User.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique, auto-generated ID for this AffiliateUserAlert.

fields.name: is_dismissed
fields.description: Whether or not the Affiliate User has dismissed the referenced Alert.

models.name: Alert
models.description: An Alert containing a message from the Network or from HasOffers.

fields.name: content
fields.description: An extended message.  For custom alerts ("type_code" of "100"), this may be present and contain extended/detailed information.  Not applicable other "type_code" values.

fields.name: data
fields.description: This is required if the "type_code" is anything other than "100".  External callers should not generate alerts that require this field.  This is a serialized object containing data required for the associated "type_code".

fields.name: date
fields.description: The date the Alert was created.

fields.name: datetime
fields.description: The date the Alert was created.

fields.name: description
fields.description: A brief message/overview.  May be supplemented or replaced by additional details in the "content" field.

fields.name: employee_id
fields.description: Applies only to Alerts created manually in the application.  This is the ID of the Employee that created the Alert.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique ID for the Alert.

fields.name: ref_affiliate_id
fields.description: For Alerts related to Affiliate fraud ("type_code" of 401, 402, 501, 502) this is the Affiliate ID referenced by the Alert.

fields.name: ref_key
fields.description: DEPRECATED.  These are used internally for certain Affiliate fraud-related Alerts.  The "type_code" should be consulted instead to determine the type of Alert.

fields.name: ref_id
fields.description: DEPRECATED.  This field should be ignored.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The status of the Alert.

fields.name: title
fields.description: The title of the Alert.  This is required if the "type_code" is "100".

fields.name: type_code
fields.description: Do not create Alerts with "type_code" other than "100" as those codes are reserved for HasOffers-generated alerts.  A number identifying the type of Alert.  "100" is a custom Alert that could contain any message.  "201": New Affiliate.  "202": New pending Affiliate.  "203": Affiliate Manager assigned.  "301": New Advertiser.  "302": New pending Advertiser.  "303": Advertiser Manager assigned.  "401": Affiliate activity fraud block.  "402": Affiliate activity fraud alert.  "501": Affiliate profile fraud block.  "502": Affiliate profile fraud alert.  "601": Offer Application has been approved.  "602": Offer Application has been denied.  "603": Offer Application is pending.

models.name: StaticApiKey
models.description: Static API Keys are used by Affiliate Users to make requests to API V3.  These cannot be generated if the "enable_affiliate_api" Preference is not enabled.

fields.name: api_key
fields.description: This is the secret string the user presents in order to use the API key.

fields.name: created
fields.description: The date this key was created.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique, auto-generated ID for the key.  This is NOT the secret part of the key that is passed in order to use it.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The status of the key.  Only "active" keys can be used.  When a key is created initially, its status is set based on the value of the "enable_affiliate_api" Preference.  If the value of that preference is "auto" then the status is set to "active" immediately.  Otherwise the status is set to "pending" by default.

fields.name: updated
fields.description: The last time the key was updated, i.e. the last time its status was changed.

fields.name: user_id
fields.description: The Affiliate User ID to which the key belongs to.

fields.name: user_type
fields.description: Identifies the account type of the user whose key this is.  Currently only used by Affiliates.

fields.name: note

models.name: CashflowGroup
models.description: A Payout and Revenue Group (AKA Cashflow Group) consists of a set of Rules which specify conditions that must pass in order for an event such as a conversion to receive a specific payout or revenue. For instance, a Payout and Revenue Group may have a Rule that requires the conversion to be for specific countries, or from specific browsers. For more information, see http://support.hasoffers.com/entries/49757686-NEW-Payout-Revenue-Groups. In order to use a CashflowGroup with an Offer or Goal, a PayoutGroupGoal, RevenueGroupGoal, PayoutGroupOffer, or RevenueGroupOffer, must be created with a reference to this CashflowGroup.

fields.name: affiliates
fields.description: A list of affiliates that have been assigned to this Payout and Revenue Group.  May not be present in all contexts.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique ID for the CashflowGroup.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The unique name of the CashflowGroup.

fields.name: description
fields.description: A description of the CashflowGroup, typically giving an overview of its Rules.

fields.name: rules
fields.description: An array of CashflowGroup Rules that define conditions that must be met in order to receive a certain payout/revenue.  Rules consist of a field (e.g. country or aff_sub1), operator (e.g. STARTS_WITH), value (e.g. "Foo"), and optional negation (true/false).  In order for a Rule to be satisfied, the event must match on each field + operator + value combination defined in the rules.  For example, a rule with "field" set to "country", operator of "IN", and value of [US, CA], would only be satisfied if the conversion originated from the United States or Canada.

models.name: PayoutGroupGoal
models.description: Associates a Cashflow Group with a Goal for the purpose of Payout calculations.  In doing so, if the rules of the Cashflow Group match and the Affiliate belongs to the group, the payout specified in this model will be used.  Only applicable to Goals which have the "use_payout_groups" field set to "1".

fields.name: cashflow_group_id
fields.description: The Cashflow Group ID whose rules and affiliates will be used.

fields.name: goal_id
fields.description: The Goal to which this Payout Group is assigned.  Cannot be modified after creation.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique, auto-generated ID for this PayoutGroupGoal.

fields.name: percent
fields.description: The percent of the amount to payout.  Must be set if the Goal has a "payout_type" of "cpa_percentage" or "cpa_both".

fields.name: rate
fields.description: A flat amount to payout.  Must be set if the Goal has a "payout_type" of "cpa_flat" or "cpa_both".

models.name: RevenueGroupGoal
models.description: Associates a Cashflow Group with a Goal for the purpose of Revenue calculations.  In doing so, if the rules of the Cashflow Group match and the Affiliate belongs to the group, the revenue specified in this model will be used.  Only applicable to Goals which have the "use_revenue_groups" field set to "1".

fields.name: cashflow_group_id
fields.description: The Cashflow Group ID whose rules and affiliates will be used.

fields.name: goal_id
fields.description: The Goal to which this Revenue Group is assigned.  Cannot be modified after creation.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique, auto-generated ID for this RevenueGroupGoal.

fields.name: percent
fields.description: The percent of the amount to revenue.  Must be set if the Goal has a "revenue_type" of "cpa_percentage" or "cpa_both".

fields.name: rate
fields.description: A flat amount to revenue.  Must be set if the Goal has a "revenue_type" of "cpa_flat" or "cpa_both".

models.name: PayoutGroupOffer
models.description: Associates a Cashflow Group with a Offer for the purpose of Payout calculations.  In doing so, if the rules of the Cashflow Group match and the Affiliate belongs to the group, the payout specified in this model will be used.  Only applicable to Offers which have the "use_payout_groups" field set to "1".

fields.name: cashflow_group_id
fields.description: The Cashflow Group ID whose rules and affiliates will be used.

fields.name: offer_id
fields.description: The Offer to which this Payout Group is assigned.  Cannot be modified after creation.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique, auto-generated ID for this PayoutGroupOffer.

fields.name: percent
fields.description: The percent of the amount to payout.  Must be set if the Offer has a "payout_type" of "cpa_percentage" or "cpa_both".

fields.name: rate
fields.description: A flat amount to payout.  Must be set if the Offer has a "payout_type" of "cpc", "cpm", "cpa_flat", or "cpa_both".

models.name: RevenueGroupOffer
models.description: Associates a Cashflow Group with a Offer for the purpose of Revenue calculations.  In doing so, if the rules of the Cashflow Group match and the Affiliate belongs to the group, the revenue specified in this model will be used.  Only applicable to Offers which have the "use_revenue_groups" field set to "1".

fields.name: cashflow_group_id
fields.description: The Cashflow Group ID whose rules and affiliates will be used.

fields.name: offer_id
fields.description: The Offer to which this Revenue Group is assigned.  Cannot be modified after creation.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique, auto-generated ID for this RevenueGroupOffer.

fields.name: percent
fields.description: The percent of the amount to revenue.  Must be set if the Offer has a "revenue_type" of "cpa_percentage" or "cpa_both".

fields.name: rate
fields.description: A flat amount to revenue.  Must be set if the Offer has a "revenue_type" of "cpc", "cpm", "cpa_flat", or "cpa_both".

models.name: CustomMenuLink
models.description: A Custom Menu Link is how Networks can add additional links to the default set of navigation in the platform applications.

fields.name: custom_page_id
fields.description: The ID of the CustomPage whose HTML contains the linked content to display when the Custom Menu Link is clicked on.  Even CustomMenuLinks whose "location" is "external" must reference a CustomPage in order to function properly; its "title" and "html" fields will simply be ignored.

fields.name: external_url
fields.description: If the "location" is set to "external" this contains the destination URL that the link points to.  If "location" is "internal" this should be set to an empty string as it will be disregarded.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique, auto-generated ID for this Custom Menu Link.

fields.name: interface
fields.description: What type of user the link should be visible to.

fields.name: location
fields.description: Whether the page is hosted inside the application ("internal") with title and HTML taken from the related CustomPage, or is a link to another website ("external").

fields.name: placement
fields.description: Whether the link should appear above or below the default links in the navigation header/tab in which it resides.

fields.name: position
fields.description: If multiple Custom Menu Links exist for the same "interface" and "tab", this will dictate the ordering of those links within the tab relative to each other.

fields.name: tab
fields.description: Which navigation header/tab in the application that the link should appear under.  If "interface" is set to "affiliate" the valid tabs are ("account", "ad_manager", "offers", "snapshot", "stats", "support").  If "interface" is set to "advertiser" the valid tabs are ("account", "offers", "snapshot", "stats", "support").  If "interface" is set to "employee" the valid tabs are ("ad_manager", "advertisers", "affiliates", "company", "offers", "reports", "snapshot", "support").

fields.name: title
fields.description: This is the name that will appear for the link.

fields.name: type

models.name: DataAudit
models.description: A log of a change to a model instance.  This can describe a create, update, or delete.

fields.name: action_time_utc
fields.description: The time of the change (UTC).

fields.name: detected_ip
fields.description: The IP address that performed the request to the API.  This may not be the user's IP address if the action was performed via the application, in which case it would be the IP address of the application server.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique, auto-generated ID for this audit entry.

fields.name: new_data
fields.description: A non-null value is present only if "operation" is "insert" or "update".  For inserts this contains a copy of the entire model.  For updates this contains the new values only for the fields that were modified in the update.

fields.name: old_data
fields.description: A non-null value is present only if "operation" is "update" or "delete".  For updates this contains the values that were overwritten by the change.  For deletes this is a copy of the entire model that was removed.

fields.name: operation
fields.description: The operation this audit entry describes.  Note that "delete" only refers to hard-deleted objects.  If a model is soft-deleted it would be tagged as an "update" with a "status" change.

fields.name: source
fields.description: If any additional information is known about the place in which the audit was generated, e.g. the application page, it will be present here.

fields.name: table_name
fields.description: The name of the table in which the model instances live, to which this change was made.  These are typically similar to the model names but are not the same.  For example, a change to an Offer model would have a table name of "offers".

fields.name: table_pkey_name
fields.description: The name of the model field which uniquely identifies instances of that model.  For example, the "id" field is the unique identifier for Offer model instances.

fields.name: table_row_pkey_val
fields.description: The unique ID of the model instance that is being audited.  Typically the "id" of the corresponding model.

fields.name: user_id
fields.description: The ID of the user (Advertiser User, Affiliate User, Employee) if known.  This will be blank for direct API requests as they are not tied to a specific user.

fields.name: user_ip
fields.description: For requests made via the Admin application or legacy Affiliate interface, this will contain the IP address of the user that made the request.  For direct API requests and requests from the Publisher Interface, the "detected_ip" field should be consulted to determine the requester's IP address.

fields.name: user_type
fields.description: The type of user that made the request, if known.  Not present for direct API requests as they do not have a specific user associated with them.

models.name: Employee

Other possible permissions are: "Brand.stats" (Ability to view stats, graphs and reports), "Brand.billing" (Ability to view and maintain billing information), "Brand.offer_management" (Ability to edit offer information), "Brand.affiliate_management" (Ability to manage affiliate accounts), "Brand.lead_management" (Ability to manage the conversions for an account/offer), "Brand.global_management" (Ability to use permissions across all accounts and not just specifically accounts the Employee directly manages), "Brand.brand_management" (Ability to manage brand preferences and customization), "Brand.virtual_user" (Ability to virtual user as an affiliate), "Brand.file_management" (Ability to manage offer files), "Brand.offer_monitor_management" (Ability to manage offer monitors), "Brand.alert_management" (Ability to manage alerts), "Brand.dne_management" (Ability to manage DNE lists), "Brand.employee_management" (ability to add,edit,delete employees), "Brand.advertiser_management" (Ability to manage advertiser accounts).

fields.name: employee_id
fields.description: The Employee ID.

fields.description: Metric used from stats to base commission calculations.

fields.description: Rate used to compute commission calculation.  This is a percentage, e.g. "10.5" to indicate a 10.5% commission.

fields.description: Method to compute commission from field.  Select "flat" if a commission is being made per each addition field.  Select "percentage" to compute commission as a percentage of the field.  Example 1: "rate_type" is "flat", "field" is  "leads", 10 leads x $5 per lead = $50 commission.  Example 2: "rate_type" is "percentage", "field" is "payout": $100 in payout x 5% = $5 commission.

models.description: A Goal for an Offer. Applicable only if the "enable_offer_goals" Preference is enabled. The related Offer must also have the "has_goals_enabled" field enabled. For more information, see: http://support.hasoffers.com/hc/en-us/articles/202674298-Offer-Goals.

fields.name: advertiser_id

fields.name: default_payout
fields.description: The flat rate/amount paid for this Goal.  The value in this field is applicable only if "payout_type" is set to "cpa_flat" or "cpa_both".

fields.description: A description of this Goal.

fields.description: Whether or not to display the Advertiser to users who otherwise lack permission to view them in the application.

fields.name: id

fields.description: Enabling this setting will close the active session when this Goal is converted.  This prevents the user from further converting on the Offer unless another active session is started.  Set this to enabled on the last Goal in the flow process.

"cpa_percentage" indicates that a percentage of the sale will be paid, specified in the "percent_payout" field.  "cpa_both" indicates that both a flat rate and a percentage of the sale will be paid.

fields.name: revenue_type
fields.description: Specifies the method of calculating revenue for this Goal.  "cpa_flat" indicates a flat amount will be revenue, specified in the "default_payout" field.  "cpa_percentage" indicates that a percentage of the sale will be revenue, specified in the "percent_payout" field.  "cpa_both" indicates that both a flat rate and a percentage of the sale will be revenue.

fields.name: use_revenue_groups

fields.name: offer_url
fields.description:
The URL to redirect all tracking links for the Offer URL. There are several optional variables that can be included in the "offer_url" which will be replaced before redirection.

Affiliate ID - Include {affiliate_id} and it will be replaced by the ID of the Affiliate promoting the offer.

Affiliate Sub ID - Include {aff_sub} and it will be replaced by the value of Affiliate Sub ID passed in via an affiliate tracking link.

Affiliate Source - Include {source} and it will be replaced by the value of Affiliate Source passed in via an affiliate tracking link.

Offer ID - Include {offer_id} and it will be replaced by the ID of the Offer.

Offer URL ID - Include {offer_url_id} and it will be replaced by the ID of the Offer URL used.

Advertiser ID - Include {advertiser_id} and it will be replaced by the ID of the Advertiser of the offer.

Country Code - Include {country_code} and it will be replaced by the user's country code (ISO 2-letter code, i.e. US).

Custom Variables - Include {params} if the Custom Variables option above is enabled. {params} will be replaced by the extra variables passed by the Affiliate into the affiliate tracking link.

Transaction ID - Include {transaction_id} to send a unique transaction number to the Advertiser. Use this when trying to verify individual leads or when server response tracking is required.

Offer Reference ID - Include {offer_ref} and it will be replaced by the Reference ID of the offer.

Affiliate Reference ID - Include {affiliate_ref} and it will be replaced by the Reference ID of the Affiliate promoting the offer.

Advertiser Reference ID - Include {advertiser_ref} and it will be replaced by the Reference ID of the Advertiser of the offer.

fields.name: preview_url
fields.description: A URL that often skips any geo-targeting or other re-targeting implemented on the "offer_url".  Allows users to view a sample landing page.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The status of this Offer URL.

models.name: OfferWhitelist
models.description: A whitelisted source of conversion requests for an offer. Applicable if the "enable_offer_whitelist" preference is enabled. A maximum of 100 whitelist entries can be created per Offer. For more information, see: http://support.hasoffers.com/hc/en-us/articles/202674328-Offer-Whitelist and http://support.hasoffers.com/hc/en-us/articles/203338637-Tracking-Settings#offer-whitelisting

fields.name: content
fields.description: Depending on the "type", this holds the IP address (e.g. 192.0.2.0), range of IP addresses (e.g. 192.0.2.0-255), IP subnet (e.g. 192.0.2.0/24), or domain (e.g. tune.com) being whitelisted.

fields.name: content_type
fields.description: The type of source being whitelisted (IP address, IP address range, IP subnet, or domain).  If the "type" is "refer" then the only valid "content_type" is "domain".  If the "type" is "postback" then the valid "content_type" options are "ip_address", "ip_range", and "ip_subnet".

fields.name: datetime
fields.description: The date this whitelist entry was created.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique, auto-generated ID for this whitelist entry.

fields.name: offer_id
fields.description: The ID of the Offer this whitelist belongs to.  The referenced Offer must have "enable_offer_whitelist" enabled.

fields.name: type
fields.description: If this IP whitelist corresponds to a postback or to a referrer.  If the Offer "protocol" is "server" or "server_affiliate" then the whitelist "type" must be "postback", else it must be "refer".

models.name: Offer
models.description: An Offer. For more information on Offers, see: http://support.hasoffers.com/hc/en-us/articles/202305276-Offer-Overview and http://support.hasoffers.com/hc/en-us/articles/202266823-Offer-Tracking-Settings.

fields.name: advertiser_id
fields.description: The ID of the Advertiser this Offer is for, if applicable.

fields.name: allow_direct_links
fields.description: Whether this Offer supports Direct Links, allowing the offer URL/landing page URL to be used directly as the Affiliate tracking link. For more information, see: http://support.hasoffers.com/hc/en-us/articles/202966146-Direct-Links.

fields.name: allow_multiple_conversions
fields.description: Whether this Offer supports Multiple Conversions.  This allows more than one Conversion to come in from a single session.  If disabled, any Conversion after the first with the same transaction ID will be rejected.

fields.name: allow_website_links
fields.description: If enabled, Affiliates are allowed to pull links from the Offer website and redirect their tracking links to specific pages. For more information, see: http://support.hasoffers.com/hc/en-us/articles/202266853-Affiliate-Tracking-Links#website-links

fields.name: approve_conversions
fields.description: Whether Conversions for this Offer must be manually approved.  If enabled, Conversions will receive a "status" of "pending" when generated.

fields.name: click_macro_url
fields.description: The URL to use as a Click Macro. Applicable only if "disable_click_macro" is false. For more information, see: http://support.hasoffers.com/hc/en-us/articles/202266853-Affiliate-Tracking-Links#adding-a-click-macro.

fields.name: conversion_cap
fields.description: Maximum number of conversions allowed per Affiliate per day for this Offer. If value is set to "0" then there is no cap. For more information, see: http://support.hasoffers.com/hc/en-us/articles/202305346-Conversion-Payout-Revenue-Caps.

fields.name: conversion_ratio_threshold
fields.description: DEPRECATED.  Ignore the contents of this field as it is not used.

fields.name: converted_offer_id
fields.description: The ID of the Offer to redirect to.  Applicable if "converted_offer_type" is set to "network".

fields.name: converted_offer_type
fields.description: Specifies whether to redirect users who have already converted on the Offer to another Offer in the network or to an external URL.  If set to "network" then the redirected Offer is identified by the "converted_offer_id" field.  If set to "url" then the redirect is identified by the "converted_offer_url" field.  Applicable if the "enable_offer_redirects" Preference is enabled and the "is_seo_friendly_301" field is false.

fields.name: converted_offer_url
fields.description: The external URL to redirect to.  Applicable if "converted_offer_type" is set to "url".

fields.name: currency
fields.description: The 3-character currency symbol for this Offer.  If NULL, the network currency identified by the "network_currency" will be used.

fields.name: customer_list_id
fields.description: The ID of the Customer List to use for this Offer.

fields.name: default_goal_name
fields.description: If the Offer has Goals enabled (indicated by the "has_goals_enabled" field), this is the name of the default Goal.

fields.name: default_payout
fields.description: The flat rate/amount paid for this Offer.  Applicable only for Offers whose "payout_type" includes a flat rate component, i.e. "cpa_flat", "cpa_both", "cpc", and "cpm".

fields.name: description
fields.description: A description for the Offer.

fields.name: disable_click_macro
fields.description: Whether to track all clicks through a 3rd party service.  The Global Click Macro will be used unless Custom Click Macro is set.  Include the "{redirect}" or "{eredirect}" param to have clicks redirect to the 3rd party service, or omit these params to have a Server Response to the provided Click Macro URL.

fields.name: display_advertiser
fields.description: Whether to display the Advertiser associated with this Offer to Affiliates.

fields.name: dne_download_url
fields.description: If a DNE (Do Not Email) List is associated with this Offer, this will contain the URL to download the list.

fields.name: dne_list_id
fields.description: The ID of the DNE (Do Not Email) List associated with this Offer, if one exists.  Present when the Offer has DNE Lists enabled, indicated by the "show_mail_list" field

fields.name: dne_unsubscribe_url
fields.description: If a DNE (Do Not Email) List is associated with this Offer, this field will contain a URL where email addresses can be added to the DNE List.

fields.name: email_instructions
fields.description: Indicates whether or not there are specific criteria required for the email subject and "from" lines Affiliates must use in communications promoting the Offer.

fields.name: email_instructions_from
fields.description: Applicable when the "email_instructions" field is set to "1".  Indicates one or more acceptable "from" lines that can be used when promoting the Offer.  Valid lines are separated by line breaks.

fields.name: email_instructions_subject
fields.description: Applicable when the "email_instructions" field is set to "1".  Indicates one or more acceptable subject lines that can be used when promoting the Offer.  Valid lines are separated by line breaks.

fields.name: enable_offer_whitelist
fields.description: Whether to require Conversion requests for this Offer to be validated against a list of acceptable IP addresses or referrer domain.  NOTE: Server Postback Offers only have the option to whitelist IP addresses.

fields.name: enforce_encrypt_tracking_pixels
fields.description: Whether to enforce that conversion tracking pixels and URLs must be encrypted.  If disabled, allows dynamic conversion tracking URLs to be used.

fields.name: enforce_geo_targeting
fields.description: Whether to enforce Geo Targeting settings on this Offer.  If not enabled here, any defined Geo Targeting settings will be ignored.

fields.name: expiration_date
fields.description: The expiration date of the Offer.

fields.name: featured
fields.description: The date from which this Offer is to be featured in the application.  If NULL or set to "0000-00-00 00:00:00" this Offer is not currently featured.  Any other valid date is the begin date of the featured status.

fields.name: has_goals_enabled
fields.description: Whether this Offer has Goals enabled. The "enable_offer_goals" Preference must be enabled in order to use Goals on Offers. For more information, see: http://support.hasoffers.com/hc/en-us/articles/202674298-Offer-Goals.

fields.name: hostname_id
fields.description: The ID of the custom Hostname to use as an alternative tracking domain. Uses the default tracking domain if NULL. For morem information, see: http://support.hasoffers.com/hc/en-us/articles/203332377-Adding-Custom-Domains#multiple-tracking-domains.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique, auto-generated ID for this Offer.

fields.name: is_expired
fields.description: Whether the Offer is expired (past "expiration_date").

fields.name: is_private
fields.description: Whether to hide the Offer from Affiliates, allowing the Network to manually grant access to specific Affiliates.

fields.name: is_seo_friendly_301
fields.description: Whether to use SEO friendly tracking links. NOTE: Enabling this setting on an Offer causes several other features to become disabled: geo-targeting, advanced targeting, conversions caps. For more information, see: http://support.hasoffers.com/hc/en-us/articles/202967406-Tiny-URLs-SEO-Friendly-Links#SEO-friendly-links.

fields.name: is_subscription
fields.description: Whether this Offer is Subscription based. For more information, see: http://support.hasoffers.com/hc/en-us/articles/202674308-Subscriptions.

fields.name: max_payout
fields.description: The flat rate/amount of revenue for this Offer.  Applicable only for Offers whose "revenue_type" includes a flat rate component, i.e. "cpa_flat", "cpa_both", "cpc", and "cpm".

fields.name: max_percent_payout
fields.description: The percent of sale received as revenue for this Offer.  For example, a value of "25.00" would indicate a 25% revenue.  Applicable only for Offers whose "revenue_type" includes a percent component, i.e. "cpa_percentage" and "cpa_both".

fields.name: modified
fields.description: The last time the Offer was updated.

fields.name: monthly_conversion_cap
fields.description: Maximum number of conversions allowed per Affiliate per month for this Offer. If value is set to "0" then there is no cap. For more information, see: http://support.hasoffers.com/hc/en-us/articles/202305346-Conversion-Payout-Revenue-Caps.

fields.name: monthly_payout_cap
fields.description: Maximum payout allowed per Affiliate per month for this Offer. If value is set to "0.00" then there is no cap. For more information, see: http://support.hasoffers.com/hc/en-us/articles/202305346-Conversion-Payout-Revenue-Caps.

fields.name: monthly_revenue_cap
fields.description: Maximum revenue allowed per Affiliate per month for this Offer. If value is set to "0.00" then there is no cap. For more information, see: http://support.hasoffers.com/hc/en-us/articles/202305346-Conversion-Payout-Revenue-Caps.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The display name for the Offer.

fields.name: note
fields.description: Notes about this Offer to display to Affiliates.

fields.name: offer_url
fields.description: The default Offer URL where traffic will be redirected to. Several optional variables/macros can be included in an Offer URL. For more information, see: http://support.hasoffers.com/hc/en-us/articles/202266863-Passing-Values-to-Offer-URLs#supported-macros-to-be-passed.

fields.name: payout_cap
fields.description: The maximum payout allowed per Affiliate per day for this Offer. If value is set to "0.00" then there is no cap. For more information, see: http://support.hasoffers.com/hc/en-us/articles/202305346-Conversion-Payout-Revenue-Caps.

fields.name: payout_type
fields.description: Specifies the method of calculating payout for this Offer.  "cpa_flat", "cpm", and "cpc" indicate a flat amount will be paid, specified in the "default_payout" field.  "cpa_percentage" indicates that a percentage of the sale will be paid, specified in the "percent_payout" field.  "cpa_both" indicates that both a flat rate and a percentage of the sale will be paid.

fields.name: percent_payout
fields.description: The percent of sale paid for this Offer.  For example, a value of "25.00" would indicate a 25% payout.  Applicable only for Offers whose "payout_type" includes a percent component, i.e. "cpa_percentage" and "cpa_both".

fields.name: preview_url
fields.description: URL that often skips any geo-targeting or other re-targeting implemented by the Offer URL.  Allows Affiliates to view sample landing page.

fields.name: protocol
fields.description: The Conversion tracking method to use for the Offer. "http" is HTTP iFrame Pixel. "https" is HTTPS iFrame Pixel. "http_img" is HTTP Image Pixel. "https_img" is HTTPS Image Pixel. "server" is Server Postback w/ Transaction ID. "server_affiliate" is Server Postback w/ Affiliate ID. "mobile_app" is Mobile App Postback. "mobile_device" is Mobile Device Postback. "pay_per_call" is Invoca (formerly RingRevenue). For more information, see: http://support.hasoffers.com/hc/en-us/articles/202674378-Conversion-Tracking-Basics#protocols.

fields.name: rating
fields.description: A rating the Offers based on performance by category, displayed to Affiliates and Employees.  If the "enable_offer_ratings" Preference is enabled, the system will periodically update this field.  Ratings are 1 to 5 with 1 the worst and 5 the best.  Offers are benchmarked by Affiliate performance with the Offers.  Offer ratings a good indication to Affiliates as well as Employees which Offers are performing the best on the network.

fields.name: redirect_offer_id
fields.description: The ID of another Offer to redirect traffic to if the offer has exceeded its conversion cap or the Offer is paused.

fields.name: ref_id
fields.description: An optional ID used to reference campaigns or offers in 3rd party systems.

fields.name: require_approval
fields.description: Whether this Offer requires manual approval before an Affiliate can run it.

fields.name: require_terms_and_conditions
fields.description: Whether or not this Offer requires prior approval before an Affiliate can run it.  The text of the terms and conditions is in the "terms_and_conditions" field.

fields.name: revenue_cap
fields.description: The maximum revenue that can be generated per Affiliate per day for this Offer.  If value is set to "0.00" then there is no cap.

fields.name: revenue_type
fields.description: Specifies the method of calculating revenues for this Offer.  "cpa_flat", "cpm", and "cpc" indicate a flat amount revenue, specified in the "max_payout" field.  "cpa_percentage" indicates that a percentage of the sale is revenue, specified in the "max_percent_payout" field.  "cpa_both" indicates that both a flat rate and a percentage of the sale are revenue.

fields.name: session_hours
fields.description: The number of hours to keep the click session active for this Offer.

fields.name: session_impression_hours
fields.description: The number of hours to keep the impression session active for this Offer.  Applicable if "set_session_on_impression" is true.

fields.name: set_session_on_impression
fields.description: If true, the session begins on impression.  If false, the session begins on click.

fields.name: show_custom_variables
fields.description: Whether custom parameters should be added to Affiliate tracking links. For more information, see: http://support.hasoffers.com/hc/en-us/articles/202966126-Custom-Variables.

fields.name: show_mail_list
fields.description: Indicates whether a DNE List is attached to this Offer.  See the "dne_list_id" field for the ID of the list, and the "dne_download_url" and the related "dne_unsubscribe_url" fields.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The status of the Offer.

fields.name: subscription_duration
fields.description: The duration of the Subscription for this Offer. Applicable if "is_subscription" is true. For more information, see: http://support.hasoffers.com/hc/en-us/articles/202674308-Subscriptions.

fields.name: subscription_frequency
fields.description: The frequency of this Subscription for this Offer. Applicable if "is_subscription" is true. For more information, see: http://support.hasoffers.com/hc/en-us/articles/202674308-Subscriptions.

fields.name: target_browsers
fields.description: DEPRECATED.  This holds the legacy Browser Targeting setting.  A value of "0" indicates it is disabled.  New Offers should use Advanced Targeting instead.

fields.name: terms_and_conditions
fields.description: The terms and conditions Affiliates must agree to in order to run this Offer.  Should be present if "require_terms_and_conditions" is set to "enabled".

fields.name: tiered_payout
fields.description: Whether this Offer uses Affiliate Tiers to calculate payouts. Cannot be enabled at the same time as "use_payout_groups". For more information, see: http://support.hasoffers.com/hc/en-us/articles/202812086-Affiliate-Payout-Tiers.

fields.name: tiered_revenue
fields.description: Whether this Offer uses Affiliate Tiers to calculate revenues. Cannot be enabled at the same time as "use_revenue_groups". For more information, see: http://support.hasoffers.com/hc/en-us/articles/202812086-Affiliate-Payout-Tiers.

fields.name: use_payout_groups
fields.description: Whether this Offer uses Payout Groups in order to calculate payouts. Cannot be enabled at the same time as "tiered_payout". For more information, see: http://support.hasoffers.com/hc/en-us/articles/202305336-Payout-Revenue-Groups.

fields.name: use_revenue_groups
fields.description: Whether this Offer uses Revenue Groups in order to calculate revenues. Cannot be enabled at the same time as "tiered_revenue". For more information, see: http://support.hasoffers.com/hc/en-us/articles/202305336-Payout-Revenue-Groups.

fields.name: use_target_rules
fields.description: Whether or not this Offer has Advanced Targeting enabled. For more information, see: http://support.hasoffers.com/hc/en-us/articles/202305356-Advanced-Targeting.

models.name: TargetRule
models.description: Target Rules are used to identify requests that have certain specific characteristics. For one or more of the fields prefixed with "req_", a regular expression is stored that is executed against the relevant fields from the request. Any regex field having a non-NULL value is ANDed together. Regular expressions are executed in case-insensitive mode. For example, if "req_device_os" is set to "^Android$" and "req_device_os_version" is set to "^4\.0" then the rule would match requests made by Android device versions with Ice Cream Sandwich (versions 4.0 – 4.0.4). For more information or to find out how to match a particular device, visit http://tera-wurfl.com/explore/. Looking at some of the preset rules defined by HasOffers can provide additional guidance on how to use each field.

fields.name: category
fields.description: Only applies to rules having a "source" of "preset"; used to categorize the HasOffers rules.

fields.name: description
fields.description: Description for the rule.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique, auto-generated ID for this rule.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name given to the rule.

fields.name: req_affiliate_info1
fields.description: A regular expression to match against the "affiliate_info" / "affiliate_info1" parameter.

fields.name: req_affiliate_info2
fields.description: A regular expression to match against the "affiliate_info2" parameter.

fields.name: req_affiliate_info3
fields.description: A regular expression to match against the "affiliate_info3" parameter.

fields.name: req_affiliate_info4
fields.description: A regular expression to match against the "affiliate_info4" parameter.

fields.name: req_affiliate_info5
fields.description: A regular expression to match against the "affiliate_info5" parameter.

fields.name: req_browser_name
fields.description: A regular expression to match against the requesting browser's name.

fields.name: req_browser_version
fields.description: A regular expression to match against the requesting browser's version.

fields.name: req_connection_speed
fields.description: A regular expression to match against the connection speed of the request.

fields.name: req_device_brand
fields.description: A regular expression to match against the device brand making the request.

fields.name: req_device_marketing_name
fields.description: A regular expression to match against the marketing name of the device making the request.

fields.name: req_device_model
fields.description: A regular expression to match against the device model making the request.

fields.name: req_device_os
fields.description: A regular expression to match against the device operating system making the request.

fields.name: req_device_os_version
fields.description: A regular expression to match against the device operating system version making the request.

fields.name: req_language
fields.description: A regular expression to match against the language of the client making the request.

fields.name: req_mobile_carrier
fields.description: A regular expression to match against the mobile carrier that the client is using to make the request.

fields.name: req_user_agent
fields.description: A regular expression to match against the user agent making the request.

fields.name: source
fields.description: Identifies whether this is a preset/HasOffers rule or one created by the brand/Network.  Only "brand" source rules can be modified as the "preset" ones are managed by HasOffers.

fields.name: method
fields.description: The method by which payment is made.  "m2m" is for PayQuicker Account, "m2papercheck" is for Paper Check, "m2eft" is for Electronic Funds Transfer (EFT/ACH), "usach" (DEPRECATED; use "m2eft" instead) is for U.S. EFT/ACH, and "advanced" is for advanced PayQuicker payment configuration.

fields.name: usach_account_number
fields.description: Account number.  Applicable only if "method" is set to "usach".

fields.name: usach_account_type

fields.name: usach_first_name

fields.name: usach_last_name
fields.description: Last name on the account.  Applicable only if "method" is set to "usach".

fields.name: usach_routing_number
fields.description: Routing number for the account.  Applicable only if "method" is set to "usach".

models.name: PaymentMethodPayoneer
models.description: The payee details for an Affiliate who receives payment via Payoneer.  In effect only if the Affiliate's "payment_method" field is set to "payoneer".

fields.name: affiliate_id
fields.description: The ID of the Affiliate whose payment details are specified.

fields.name: status
fields.description: WARNING: it is not recommended to update this field.  Changes made to the status here will not be pushed to Payoneer.  Updates to this field should be made by Payoneer only.  The status of the link between Payoneer and the Affiliate account.  After signing up with Payoneer and linking it to the Affiliate account, this status will be updated automatically once Payoneer processes the request.

models.name: PaymentMethodPaypal
models.description: The payee details for an Affiliate who receives payment via Paypal.  In effect only if the Affiliate's "payment_method" field is set to "paypal".

fields.description: The ID of the Affiliate whose payment details are specified.

fields.name: email
fields.description: The email address associated with the payee's Paypal account.

fields.name: modified

models.name: PaymentMethodWire

fields.description: Affiliate sub 1 passed in by the Affiliate when the session was started.

fields.name: Stat.affiliate_info5
fields.description: Affiliate sub 5 passed in by the Affiliate when the session was started.

fields.description: The ID of the Employee who is the account manager for the Affiliate.  If none is set, defaults to "0".

fields.name: Stat.browser_id
fields.description: The ID of the Browser.  If a Browser was not identified, defaults to "0".

fields.name: Stat.clicks
fields.description: An aggregate field counting the number of clicks.

fields.name: Stat.conversions
fields.description: An aggregate field counting the number of conversions.

fields.name: Stat.count
fields.description: An aggregate field counting the number of matching rows.

fields.name: Stat.country_code
fields.description: The country code.

fields.name: Stat.cpa
fields.description: Cost per Acquisition, Payout per Conversion: (Stat.payout / Stat.conversions).

fields.name: Stat.cpc
fields.description: Cost per Click, Payout per Click: (Stat.payout / Stat.clicks).

fields.name: Stat.cpm
fields.description: Cost per Thousand Impressions: (Stat.payout / (Stat.impressions / 1000)).

fields.name: Stat.creative_url_id
fields.description: The ID of the Offer URL.  If none is set, defaults to "0".

fields.name: Stat.ctr
fields.description: Click through Rate: (Stat.clicks / Stat.impressions).  NOTE: If the "track_uniques" Preference is enabled, this is (Stat.unique_clicks / Stat.impressions).

fields.name: Stat.date
fields.description: The date of the event.

fields.name: Stat.epc
fields.description: Earnings per click: ((Stat.revenue - Stat.payout) / Stat.clicks).

fields.name: Stat.erpc
fields.description: Electronic Rate Per Click. This refers to the amount paid out to the Affiliate per click.

fields.name: Stat.goal_id
fields.description: The Goal ID.  If none is set, defaults to "0".

fields.name: Stat.gross_clicks
fields.description: Sum of gross clicks.

fields.name: Stat.gross_ctr
fields.description: Gross Click through Rate: (Stat.gross_clicks / Stat.impressions).

fields.name: Stat.hour
fields.description: Hour (0 to 23) of the event.

fields.name: Stat.impressions
fields.description: Sum of impressions.

fields.name: Stat.ltr
fields.description: Lead through Rate: (Stat.conversions / Stat.clicks).  NOTE: If the "track_uniques" Preference is enabled, this is (Stat.conversions / Stat.unique_clicks).

fields.name: Stat.month
fields.description: Month (1 to 12) of the event.

fields.name: Stat.offer_count
fields.description: An aggregate field counting the distinct number of Offer IDs.

fields.name: Stat.offer_file_id
fields.description: The OfferFile ID.  If none is set, defaults to "0".

fields.name: Stat.offer_id
fields.description: The Offer ID.

fields.name: Stat.offer_url_id
fields.description: The Offer URL ID.  If none is set, defaults to "0".

fields.name: Stat.payout
fields.description: The Affiliate payout amount.

fields.name: Stat.payout_type
fields.description: The Offer (or Goal, if applicable) payout type.

fields.name: Stat.profit
fields.description: The amount of profit (Stat.revenue - Stat.payout).

fields.name: Stat.revenue
fields.description: The amount of revenue generated.

fields.name: Stat.revenue_type
fields.description: The Offer (or Goal, if applicable) revenue type.

fields.name: Stat.rpa
fields.description: Revenue per Acquisition, Revenue per Conversion: (Stat.revenue / Stat.conversions).

fields.name: Stat.rpc
fields.description: Revenue per Click: (Stat.revenue / Stat.clicks).  NOTE: If the "track_uniques" Preference is enabled, this is (Stat.revenue / Stat.unique_clicks).

fields.name: Stat.rpm
fields.description: Revenue per Thousand Impressions: (Stat.revenue / (Stat.impressions / 1000)).

fields.name: Stat.sale_amount
fields.description: The sale amount.

fields.name: Stat.source
fields.description: Affiliate source passed in by the Affiliate when the session was started.  Empty string if none.

fields.name: Stat.unique_clicks
fields.description: The sum of unique clicks.

fields.name: Stat.unique_ctr
fields.description: Unique Click through Rate: (Stat.unique_clicks / Stat.impressions).

fields.name: Stat.week
fields.description: The week in which the event took place.  Range is 1 to 53, where week 1 is the first week with four (4) or more days.  Weeks begin on Monday.

fields.name: Stat.year
fields.description: The year (YYYY) the event took place.

models.name: AffiliateCommissionReport
models.description: A report detailing the commissions earned through Affiliate referrals. For more information, see: http://support.hasoffers.com/hc/en-us/articles/202305466-Affiliate-Commission-Report.

fields.name: Affiliate.company
fields.description: The company name of the Affiliate who earned ths commission.

fields.name: AffiliateManager.full_name
fields.description: The name (first and last) of the Employee who is the account manager for the Affiliate that earned this commission.

fields.name: ReferredAffiliate.company
fields.description: The company name of the referred Affiliate.

fields.name: Stat.affiliate_id
fields.description: The referred Affiliate ID.

fields.name: Stat.affiliate_manager_id
fields.description: The ID of the Employee who is the account manager for the Affiliate that earned this commission.  If no account manager exists, defaults to the value "0".

fields.name: Stat.amount
fields.description: The amount of the commission.

fields.name: Stat.date
fields.description: The date the commission was earned.

fields.name: Stat.rate
fields.description: Holds the commission rate.  When "Stat.rate_type" is "flat" this is the flat commission amount.  When "Stat.rate_type" is "percentage" this is the percent amount (e.g. 12.00 is 12%) of the commission.

fields.name: Stat.rate_type
fields.description: The calculation method used to determine the commission (flat rate or percentage).

fields.name: Stat.referral_id
fields.description: The ID of the Affiliate who earned the commission.

fields.name: Stat.var_total
fields.description: Holds the rate multiplier used to calculate the "Stat.amount".  For percentage-based commissions this is the total payout, revenue, or profit that the commission is based on.  For flat-based commissions this is either 1.00 (referred affiliate is currently active) or 0.00 (referred affiliate is not active).

models.name: ScheduledOfferChange
models.description: A scheduled change to make to an Offer or Goal. Can be used to change the status of an Offer or Goal, or the default payout or revenue amounts for them. Additionally can be used to change payout or revenue amounts on a per-Affiliate basis, or for an Affiliate Tier. For more information, see: http://support.hasoffers.com/hc/en-us/articles/202266783-Offer-Payouts.

fields.name: affiliate_id
fields.description: This should only be provided if "model" is set to "OfferPayout" or "OfferRevenue".  The ID of the Affiliate for which a payout or revenue change is being made.

fields.name: affiliate_tier_id
fields.description: This should only be provided if "model" is set to "AffiliateTierRevenue" or "AffiliateTierPayout".  The ID of the Affiliate Tier for which a payout or revenue change is being made.

fields.name: created_utc
fields.description: The date/time (UTC) this scheduled change model was created.  This is not the time the change will take effect; see "update_time_utc".

fields.name: employee_id
fields.description: The ID of the Employee to which this Scheduled Offer Change should be attributed.

fields.name: goal_id
fields.description: If the "model" is set to "Goal" this is required.  It is optional if "model" is set to "OfferPayout", "OfferRevenue", "AffiliateTierRevenue", or "AffiliateTierPayout".  It should not be provided if "model" is "Offer" as it is not applicable for Offer-model changes.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique, auto-generated ID for this Scheduled Offer Change.

fields.name: model
fields.description: Indicates the model which will be updated by this change.  "Offer" indicates that the Offer itself will be updated (status, default payout, or default revenue).  "Goal" indicates that a Goal will be updated (status, default payout, or default revenue).  "OfferPayout" indicates that an Affiliate-specific payout amount for an Offer or Goal will be updated.  "OfferRevenue" indicates that an Affiliate-specific revenue amount for an Offer or Goal will be updated.  "AffiliateTierPayout" indicates that a payout amount for an Affiliate Tier for an Offer or Goal will be updated.  "AffiliateTierRevenue" indicates that a revenue amount for an Affiliate Tier for an Offer or Goal will be updated.

fields.name: modified_utc
fields.description: The date/time (UTC) this scheduled change model was last updated.  This is not the time the change will take effect; see "update_time_utc".

fields.name: offer_id
fields.description: The ID of the Offer this change applies to.  This is required for all scheduled changes regardless of which "model" is being changed.

fields.name: scheduled_job_id
fields.description: This is an internal identifier used to track the progression of the Scheduled Offer Change.  It can be ignored.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The status of this change.  Networks should only set the statuses "active" or "deleted".  New scheduled changes should be set to "active", which indicates that the change will take effect at the scheduled date.  "deleted" can be set to cancel a scheduled change.  "completed" is a status set by the API, which indicates that the scheduled change has been executed.  "failed" is a status set by the API, which indicates that the scheduled change was attempted but failed.  Once set to "deleted" a Scheduled Offer Change cannot be updated; a new one will need to be created instead.

fields.name: type
fields.description:
This is automatically set by the API after the change request is created, to indicate the category of change.
  • "status" indicates a change in status of an Offer or Goal.
  • "payout" indicates a change in the default Offer ("model"="Offer") or Goal ("model"="Goal") payout, or a change to an Affiliate Tier Payout ("model"="AffiliateTierPayout") or Affiliate-specific payout ("model"="OfferPayout").
  • "revenue" indicates a change in the default Offer ("model"="Offer") or Goal ("model"="Goal") revenue, or a change to an Affiliate Tier Revenue ("model"="AffiliateTierRevenue") or Affiliate-specific revenue ("model"="OfferRevenue").

fields.name: update_field
fields.description:
The property being modified by this Scheduled Offer Change. The new value to set for the property is specified in the "update_value" field.
  • "status" is valid only if "model" is set to "Offer" or "Goal", and specifies that the status of the Offer or Goal be changed to the value specified in "update_value".
  • "default_payout" is valid only if "model" is set to "Offer" or "Goal", and indicates that the default flat payout will be updated to the value specified in "update_value".
  • "max_payout" is valid only if "model" is set to "Offer" or "Goal", and indicates that the default flat revenue amount will be updated to the value specified in "update_value".
  • "percent_payout" is valid only if "model" is set to "Offer" or "Goal", and indicates that the default percent payout will be updated to the value specified in "update_value".
  • "max_percent_payout" is valid only if "model" is set to "Offer" or "Goal", and indicates that the default percent revenue rate will be updated to the value specified in "update_value".
  • "rate" is valid only if "model" is set to "OfferPayout", "OfferRevenue", "AffiliateTierPayout", or "AffiliateTierRevenue", and indicates that the flat rate amount specified for the payout or revenue model will be updated to the value specified in the "update_value" field.
  • "percent" is valid only if "model" is set to "OfferPayout", "OfferRevenue", "AffiliateTierPayout", or "AffiliateTierRevenue", and indicates that the percent amount specified for the payout or revenue model will be updated to the value specified in the "update_value" field.
NOTE: changes to flat rate or percent payout fields on any model type will only take effect if the Offer or Goal has a "payout_type" or "revenue_type" that uses flat amounts or percentages in its payout or revenue calculations. Similarly, changes to tiered revenue or payouts will only take effect if the Offer or Goal has "tiered_payout" or "tiered_revenue" enabled. See the Offer and Goal models for more information.

fields.name: update_time_utc
fields.description: The date/time (UTC) that this Scheduled Offer Change should take effect.  Format is "YYYY-MM-DD HH24:MM:SS".  For example, to specify January 13, 2014 at 4:35 P.M. UTC:  "2014-01-13 16:35:00".  The scheduler will make its best attempt to execute the change at the specified date, but it cannot guarantee changes will happen precisely at the specified time.

fields.name: update_value
fields.description: The new value to set for the specified "update_field" being modified by this Scheduled Offer Change.

Get Ad Campaign code. This is typically a brief snippet which is embedded
in the affiliate's site.  It will load all the creatives / pixels / links
relevant to the ad campaign.

parameters.description: Any arbitrary key/value parameters that should be attached to the code.  Additionally, a special "hostNameId" parameter can be passed in if one of the brand's non-default hostnames (by id) is desired for the generated URL.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: The format of the code and e/redirect values to attach to it.

fields.name: format
fields.description: The format of the code desired.  If the referenced Ad Campaign has "type" set to "text" then the only valid format is "javascript".  If not provided, "format" will default to "javascript" for Ad Campaigns of type "text" and to "iframe" for all other Ad Campaign types.

fields.name: eredirect
fields.description: If included, will cause the code returned to include a "&eredirect=" querystring parameter with the provided value url encoded.

fields.name: redirect
fields.description: If included, will cause the code returned to include a "&redirect=" querystring parameter with the provided value url encoded.

response.description: Code for ad campaign.

Sign up for an Affiliate by executing the following steps:
- Validate affiliate account attribute.

- Validate affiliate user account.
- Create affiliate.
- Create a new affiliate user with the id from the newly created
  Affiliate.
- Save Affiliate meta information.
- Perform fraud validation and calculate fraud score.
- Update affiliate status from active to pending if fraud score
  exceeds the fraud threshold.
- Send alert to employee to notify affiliate and affiliate user
  have had been created.

methods.name: getApprovedOfferIds

Excluded are those which require approval and private offers for which the affiliate has not been approved, as
well as offers from advertisers who have blocked this Affiliate.

NOTE: The request must include an "affiliate" interface with the same ID being passed to this method or the list
of IDs may contain inactive or expired offers that the affiliate is otherwise approved to run.

response.description: List of Offer IDs.

has not been granted access.

Advertiser.

response.description: List of blocked Offer IDs.

methods.name: getUnblockedOfferIds

methods.longDescription:
NOTE:  If not "interface" is provided for the same affiliate passed to this method, it may contain the IDs of
Offers which the Affiliate is not able to access for reasons other than an Offer-level block (expired, inactive,
Advertiser block, etc).

response.description: List of unblocked Offer IDs.

methods.name: generateInvoices
methods.shortDescription: Generate Affiliate Invoices.
methods.longDescription:
Generate invoices for all affiliates. Invoices will be generated based on
process date and the invoice frequency for each affiliate. If the network
has a minimum invoice payment amount set then an invoice will only be
created if it meets this amount. If Generate invoices by advertiser is
disabled, generate invoices based on each currency used (if multiple
currencies is enabled). If enabled, generate invoices based on currencies
the advertiser is using.

methods.name: decryptUnsubHash
methods.shortDescription: Decrypt an email unsubscribe hash that was generated by the generateUnsubLink function, returning the user details.

response.description: Decrypted information from the encrypted hash as an array (email preference, user type, user id, followed by TTL), or returns false if the provided hash is invalid.

methods.name: generateAllUnsubLinks
methods.shortDescription: Generate unsubscribe links for multiple users.  The links will be valid for 31 days.
methods.longDescription:
NOTE: Since the response contains links indexed by user ID, you must not call this endpoint for multiple users
who are of different types with the same numeric ID, or to generate multiple different unsubscribe links (for
multiple preferences) for the same user.  For example, if calling the function to generate unsubscribe links for
an affiliate user with id 100 and an advertiser user with id 100, the response would only contain a single link.
This endpoint should be called separately in cases where the generated links would have such ID collisions.

fields.name: preference
fields.description: Affiliate Users, Advertiser Users, and Employees can all unsubscribe from Mail Room emails with the "disable_mail_room_email" preference.  Additionally, Employees can unsubscribe from HasOffers news emails using the "disable_hasoffers_news_email" preference.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The type of user for which the unsubscribe link is being generated.

fields.name: user_id
fields.description: The ID of the user for which the unsubscribe link is being generated.

response.description: An object containing unsubscribe links for each passed user, indexed by the user ID.

methods.name: generateUnsubLink
methods.shortDescription: Generates a Mail Room unsubscribe link for the specified mailing list and user.
methods.longDescription:
When the user clicks on the link it will take them to the application and cause their preference to be updated. Affiliates, Advertisers, and Employees can unsubscribe from the three mail-room related mailing lists: 
  disable_company_news_email (deprecated, but still unsubscribable);
  disable_offer_updates_email (deprecated, but still unsubscribable);
  disable_mail_room_email (replaces above two).
Employees can additionally unsubscribe from three additional lists: 
  disable_hasoffers_education_email (deprecated, but still unsubscribable);
  disable_hasoffers_updates_email (deprecated, but still unsubscribable);
  disable_hasoffers_news_email.

parameters.name: preference
parameters.description: The user_preferences key to use to unsubscribe.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: The ID of this user (affiliate_user.id, advertiser_user.id, employee.id).

parameters.name: ttl
parameters.description: The TTL in a format that strtotime() can parse.

response.description:
An array with two keys (link, hash) if the
                        unsubscribe link was successfully generated
                        and false if an error occurred.
